page.title: 11MRS KATE WILCOX-102 YEARS
page.content: Mrs. Kate Wilcox will be{102}in October 1985.An article in the { {Watford Observer}on her{101st}birthday described her as the "grandma" of the{ {Welcome Club,}held at Croxley Green Red Cross Centre.She was entertained by the concert party of the{Abbots {Langley Gilbert and Sullivan Society. She and her husband George began the club in{1952}for retired workers from Croxley Mill. Mrs. Wilcox goes to the centre each week to meet her friends and play cards.On her{100th}birthday she "brought the house down" by performing the {Lambeth Walk}to celebrate receiving her telegram from the Queen. Mrs. Wilcox was born near Maldon in Essex and moved to Croxley Green at the age of 25.She has a great love of gardening and has a conservatory full of flowers.
